intro: Hedlundia meinichii, commonly known as the red-flowered hedlundia, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture. Hedlundia meinichii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its striking appearance.
